IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: DUI ARREST Case #: 23-MSP-002743 Incident recorded on body worn camera. Defendant: Kimberly Dawn SAMOILI Date of Birth: 08/02/1974 Date of Arrest: 01/22/2023 Time of Arrest: 1945 PA License #: 27376099 DUI #: 23-048 WITNESS Fayta Craddock 3934 Kimble Rd Baltimore MD 21218 443-324-6682 TRAINING/CERTIFICATES Apprehended over 200 DUI/DWI Arrests to date. IACP National Training Conference on Drugs, Alcohol, and Impaired Driving 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022. DRE Instructor, November 2022. Distinguished graduate of the University of Maryland DUI Institute 2019. Maryland Department of Transportation Medically Impaired Driver Detection December 2018. Collision Reconstruction, March 2018. SFST Instructor, February 2018. Drug Recognition Expert, July 2017. Maryland Department of Transportation DUI Enforcement Award, 2016, 2017, 2018. Maryland Department of Transportation Impaired Driving Conference, October 2016. Advanced Roadside Impaired Driving Enforcement (A.R.I.D.E.), September 2016. Trained and certified to operate RADAR and LIDAR through the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, August 2016. National Traffic Incident Management Responder Training, March 2016. Advanced Collision Investigation, March 2016. Trained in administering Standardized Field Sobriety Tests through the Maryland State Police and National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, October 2014. VEHICLE IN MOTION (PHASE 1) On 01/22/2023 at approximately 1821 hours, I, TFC Bunger # 6459, currently assigned to the Maryland State Police Golden Barrack, was dispatched to a single vehicle at northbound I-83 at Warren Rd. Upon arrival, I located a white Jeep Wrangler bearing Pennsylvania registration JRD1434 overturned in the right shoulder. I observed a set of tire furrows in the grassy area adjacent to the paved shoulder. The tire furrows ended at the right shoulder guardrail endcap. The Jeep was overturned on its right side. It had minor damage to the front left quarter panel as well as moderate damage to the exterior, aftermarket bumper. The guardrail end cap was damaged in the collision. I made contact with Fayta Craddock, who advised that she was traveling in lane three approaching the exit for Warren Rd when she observed the Jeep travel partially into the right shoulder for an extended period of time. It then entered the grassy area and collided with the guardrail endcap and overturned. PERSONAL CONTACT (PHASE 2) When I approached the vehicle, I observed that the driver, identified by her PA drivers license as Kimberly Dawn SAMOILI 08/02/1974, was entrapped in the vehicle. She had to be assisted out by the Baltimore County Fire Department. Once she was able to exit the vehicle, she was taken to Medic 17 for evaluation. I made contact with SAMOILI inside the ambulance. She was complaining of head pain and sobbing. She advised EMTs that she did not lose consciousness or blackout. I asked her to explain the collision to me and she stated that she was coming from a girls night out and had two drinks and that was that. While speaking with her I detected the moderate odor of an alcoholic beverage on her breath and person. SAMOILIs speech was slurred and rambling, her movements slow and uncoordinated, her eyelids drooping, and her eyes appeared to be glassy and bloodshot. A check through MVA determined that her license was valid. She had no open warrants. SAMOILI was transported to Greater Baltimore Medical Center for possible injuries sustained in the collision. ARREST Based on the totality of circumstances, I had reason to believe SAMOILI was driving a motor vehicle under the influence of alcohol: Vehicle traveling partially in the right shoulder for and extended period of time and then colliding with the guardrail endcap. Slow, uncoordinated movements. Slurred speech. Glassy, bloodshot eyes. Drooping eyelids. Moderate odor of an alcoholic beverage on his breath and person. Driver admitting to consuming two drinks at a girls night out Due to the number of observations, I concluded SAMOILI was driving under the influence of alcohol and was unable to operate a vehicle safely. SAMOILI was read his DR-15 Advice of Rights at GBMC. At approximately 1945 hours, SAMOILI refused to take an alcohol concentration test and stated I dont need to prove that I had two glasses of wine. INTOXIMETER RESULT Refusal SAMOILI was released to GMBC for medical treatment. The moderate odor of an alcoholic beverage was still emanating from her breath and person. I recommend the hospitals blood test be subpoenaed for court. She was issued the following citations: CITATIONS: 21-801(b) Failure to control speed to avoid collision. 21-901(b) Negligent driving. 21-901.1(a) Reckless driving. 21-201(a1) Failure to obey traffic control device. 21-309(b) Unsafe lane change. 26-102(b) Directing or permitting vehicle contrary to law. 21-902(a1i) Driving under the influence of alcohol. 21-902(b1i) Driving while impaired by alcohol. The defendant was issued copies of the following documents: -Citations ( listed above ) -DR-15 Advice of Rights. -DR-15a All documents were forwarded to the Baltimore County, States Attorney Office. All events occurred in Baltimore County, Maryland.
